Use for ISMS internal auditing, external audit preparation, security control testing, and ISO 27001 certification support.

skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based documentation skill containing ISMS auditing expertise. All files are either prompt documentation or benign placeholder content. The 41 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES caused by the scanner misinterpreting security-related terminology (e.g., 'Cryptography', 'AES', 'penetration') as weak crypto algorithms, and flagging documentation structure syntax as command execution patterns. There is no executable code, no network calls, no file system access, and no malicious intent.

content.value_statement: Organizations need systematic security assessments to maintain ISO 27001 compliance and identify gaps. This skill provides expert guidance for ISMS audits, security control testing, and compliance verification across organizational, technical, physical, and operational domains.
actual_capabilities: Design and manage ISMS audit programs following ISO 27001 methodologies
Conduct risk-based security control assessments across technical and administrative domains
Prepare organizations for ISO 27001 certification audits and regulatory inspections
Evaluate cloud security configurations and shared responsibility model implementations
Develop security finding documentation with risk-based prioritization and recommendations
limitations: Cannot execute security scanning tools or access external systems
Cannot access or analyze actual organizational files or security logs
Cannot perform real-time security assessments or penetration testing
Does not replace certified auditors for formal compliance certifications

use_cases.title: Plan ISMS audit programs
use_cases.description: Design risk-based audit schedules, define security testing scope, and allocate technical assessment resources

use_cases.title: Prepare certification audits
use_cases.description: Review ISMS documentation, verify control implementations, and simulate certification audits before external assessment

use_cases.title: Assess security controls
use_cases.description: Evaluate access control, encryption, monitoring, and incident response controls against ISO 27002 requirements

prompt_templates.title: Quick audit guidance
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline the key steps for conducting an ISO 27001 internal audit, including preparation, execution, and reporting phases

prompt_templates.title: Control assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: What testing procedures should I use to verify the effectiveness of access control and encryption controls in an ISMS?

prompt_templates.title: Certification prep
prompt_templates.prompt: What documentation and evidence do I need to prepare for a Stage 1 ISO 27001 certification audit?

prompt_templates.title: Compliance framework
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I align ISO 27001 ISMS audit requirements with NIST Cybersecurity Framework and PCI DSS compliance requirements?

output_examples.input: What are the key phases of an ISO 27001 ISMS audit?
output: 1. Audit Planning: Define scope, objectives, and risk-based priorities based on asset criticality and threat exposure
2. Preparation: Review ISMS documentation, assign competent auditors, and establish testing methodology
3. Execution: Assess security controls through interviews, observations, and testing procedures
4. Documentation: Record findings with evidence, risk ratings, and improvement recommendations
5. Reporting: Communicate results to stakeholders with compliance status and actionable remediation guidance

output_examples.input: How do I prepare for a cloud security audit?
output: Verify CSP security certifications and compliance attestations
Review shared responsibility model documentation for your service model
Assess data residency and sovereignty compliance requirements
Evaluate cloud IAM configurations and access management controls
Review encryption implementation for data at rest and in transit

best_practices: Define clear audit scope aligned with organizational risk appetite and regulatory requirements before beginning assessments
Document all evidence and control testing results systematically to support audit conclusions and remediation tracking
Use risk-based prioritization to focus audit resources on high-risk assets and critical security controls
anti_patterns: Skipping pre-audit documentation review leads to incomplete assessments and missed control gaps
Using generic testing procedures without adapting to organizational context reduces audit value
Failing to track finding remediation undermines continuous security improvement

faq.question: Does this skill replace certified auditors?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides guidance and expertise but formal ISO 27001 certifications require accredited auditors

faq.question: Can this skill run security scans?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides guidance only. Actual scanning requires separate security tools and access

faq.question: What ISO standards does this skill cover?
faq.answer: Primary focus on ISO 27001 and ISO 27002, with additional guidance for NIST and sector-specific frameworks

faq.question: Is data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill is prompt-based only and does not access, store, or transmit any organizational data

faq.question: How do I integrate this with audit tools?
faq.answer: Use the skill to plan audit approaches, then apply findings to configure and run specialized security tools

faq.question: What makes this different from generic security advice?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured ISMS audit methodology aligned specifically with ISO 27001 requirements and auditor competencies
